discussion.content: C. Administration > Settings
C. WAN Edge Cloud Certificate Authorization by default is Automated (vManage signed).

C is correct

questions.question_text: Which two requirements must be met for DNS inspection when integrating with Cisco Umbrella? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
You need to configure the Umbrella API Token as the 1st step, then attach a DNS
Security Policy to the device in order to initiate integration from Cisco Umbrella!

A & £
Attach Security Policy to device Template
Configure the umbrella Token to VManage

REF LINK
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/routers/sdwan/configuration/security/ios-xe-17/security-book-xe/umbrella-integration.html#id_117963

Selected Answer: AE
AE correct

Selected Answer: AE
Correct Answer: AE
Correct

choices.C: Register and configure the vManage public IP and serial number in the Umbrella portal.
choices.A: Attach security policy to the device template.
choices.B: Create and attach a System feature template with the Umbrella registration credentials.
choices.D: Upload the WAN Edge serial allow list to the Umbrella portal.
choices.E: Configure the Umbrella token on the vManage.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AE
approved by the docs.

Selected Answer: AE
Evidence provided by Rita7

This document describes how Zone Based FireWall policy is defined based on the applications that NBAR
can detect and make Zone Based FireWall application aware. The Application FireWall inspects the traffic
and blocks traffic based on applications, category, application-family or application-group. This application
aware firewall feature provides the following benefits:
• Application visibility and granular control
• Classification of 1400+ layer 7 applications
• Allows or blocks traffic by application, category, application-family or application-group
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/ios-xml/ios/sec_data_zbf/configuration/xe-16-9/sec-data-zbf-xe-16-9-book/sec-data-zbf-xe-16-9-book_chapter_0100100.pdf

choices.A: blocks traffic by application or application-family

questions.question_text: Which two features does the application firewall provide? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
The correct command would be: cloud-qosservice-side
B is the closest to that, even though that's for transport sided.

comments.content:
B is correct.
And cloud-qos service-side is for service side, not for transport side

discussion.content:
For vEdge cloud and vEdge 5000 routers, to enable QoS scheduling and shaping for the
transport-side tunnel interfaces, you must use the cloud-qos command in the policy. In addition, to
enable QoS scheduling and shaping for the service-side interfaces, you must use the cloud-qosservice-side command in the policy.

a is correct

disregard my last comment.

comments.content: It's A, queue 0, LLQ .. voice with control traffic are the most critical

discussion.content:
On Cisco vEdge devices and Cisco IOS XE SD-WAN devices, each interface has eight queues, which are numbered 0 to 7. Queue 0 is reserved, and is used for both control traffic and low-latency queuing (LLQ) traffic. For LLQ, any class that is mapped to queue 0 must also be configured to use LLQ. Queues 1 to 7 are available for data traffic

Queue 0 is reserved for control plane traffic and voice traffic would fall under the data traffic segment which is from 1 to 7. 

Answer should be B -1
